attributes.action: Abolish new speeding fines as they can cause the lower classes monetary issues.
attributes.additional_details:
More details:
https://www.saga.co.uk/magazine/motoring/cars/using/the-uks-new-speeding-fines-explained

I personally see speeding fines as a money making scam and therefore should be set at a more cost effective figure, I understand the need to deter people from speeding which is why I feel the current points and partial ban system seems adequate but to cause people the issue of not being able to live seems like it will have a worse effect 
on the less fortunate of us that have bills to pay
attributes.background: New speeding fines can see motorists face fines of between 50-150% of their weekly income meaning that worst case for myself I will be fined around £430 worst case senario which is more than what I budget for spending the entire month making the lower classes worst off and can cause monetary issues

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

Sentencing guidelines, including speeding fines, are the responsibility of the Sentencing Council for England and Wales, which is independent from Government.

You can find out more about the sentencing council here: www.sentencingcouncil.org.uk/about-us/
